channel.title: It's Pretty OK
channel.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
channel.description:
Why don’t more bars serve beer in pitchers? How do you pick a song for karaoke? What does the word “home” mean to you?
Those questions range from silly to serious, but if you’ve ever pondered the answers to all three in a single day, you’re not alone. Pour yourself a cup of coffee, crack a 40, or anything in between, and join the gang here at It’s Pretty OK as we attempt to answer these questions and many more. We promise it won’t be boring.
channel.itunes:summary:
Why don’t more bars serve beer in pitchers? How do you pick a song for karaoke? What does the word “home” mean to you?
Those questions range from silly to serious, but if you’ve ever pondered the answers to all three in a single day, you’re not alone. Pour yourself a cup of coffee, crack a 40, or anything in between, and join the gang here at It’s Pretty OK as we attempt to answer these questions and many more. We promise it won’t be boring.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Why don’t more bars serve beer in pitchers? How do you pick a song for karaoke? What does the word “home” mean to you? Those questions range from silly to serious, but if you’ve ever pondered the answers to all three in a single day, you’re not alone.

item.title: Ep. 345: Lackluster Video
item.description: Wait, did they say DVDs?
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Wait, did they say DVDs?
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang is together to talk about collections of physical media — especially DVDs. Strap in!MUSIC: “Training Montage” – The Mountain Goats

item.title: Ep. 344: DRAFT TALK
item.description: The annual moment when you think “maybe this year will be different!”
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: The annual moment when you think “maybe this year will be different!”
item.itunes:summary: With Max off the board this week, the rest of the gang gets together to talk about why sports drafts — the NBA draft in particular — hold such a strong allure.MUSIC: “Silk Chiffon (feat. Phoebe Bridgers)” – MUNA

item.title: Ep. 343: FOURTHPOD
item.description: Whatever it is, let’s taco bout it
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Whatever it is, let’s taco bout it
item.itunes:summary: Whatever it is, let’s taco bout it

item.title: Ep. 342: Hot Tub Pod Machine
item.description: A conversation that’s been simmering for a while
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: A conversation that’s been simmering for a while
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang gets together to discuss hot tubs, which Sean derisively refers to at one point as “human broth” but which were a fairly significant part of Max’s search for a new place to live. I feel like that’s probably enough for you to know in order to decide whether or not this episode is for you — not unlike hot tubs themselves.MUSIC: “Always Rhyme” – Homeboy Sandman

item.title: Ep. 341: Choosy Cooks Choose...
item.description: What we cook when we cook at home
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: What we cook when we cook at home
item.itunes:summary: Sean is gone this week for a reason that may or may not have something to do with Hard Mountain Dew, but that’s not going to stop the rest of the gang from convening to talk about cooking routines. What are the things that you make a point of only eating out at restaurants (or things that you only eat at home)? And can trying cooking some of those things at home ruin the special-ness of the restaurant occasion?MUSIC: “Easy On Your Own” – Alvvays

item.title: Ep. 340: Where Have All the Rivalries Gone?
item.description: What makes the bitterest feuds in sports so great?
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: What makes the bitterest feuds in sports so great?
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang gets together to discuss whether the sports rivalry is still alive and well, particularly in professional sports in the U.S. How much of the seeming fade of these bitter rivalries is due to changing attitudes among new generations, and how much is dumb stuff like fantasy football and the ubiquity of legal sports gambling? And why do the greatest sports rivalries often have so little to do with sports themselves?MUSIC: “TV Will Always Make Me Cry” – Alien Boy

item.title: Ep. 339: BEDtv
item.description: To tube or not to tube, that is the question
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: To tube or not to tube, that is the question
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang talks about putting (or not putting) a TV in your bedroom. What goes into that momentous decision? Also, Sean gets irrationally angry about an audiobook he listened to, and as always, Pierce apologizes.MUSIC: “Hurricanes and Hand Grenades” – Jason Isbell

item.title: Ep. 338: College GamePod
item.description: Talking about all the pregame talking
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Talking about all the pregame talking
item.itunes:summary: This week, the Sports Bois™ convene to talk about the phenomenon of pregame shows, particularly for football. Two important notes:1) This was recorded before College GameDay actually went to Boone, NC, which produced (among other things) this phenomenal intro video voiced by Wright Thompson.2) Thanks to frustrating Skype connection stuff, the crosstalk/awkward pause conundrum is worse than usual!MUSIC: “Let Us Die“ – King Princess

item.title: Ep. 337: An Honest LIV-ing
item.description: Talking sportswashing and whatnot
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Talking sportswashing and whatnot
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang gets together to talk about the ways that the sports industry is changing, especially the introduction of Saudi oil money in the form of the new LIV Golf tour. And we get the most harrowing edition of “Pierce Is Sorry” yet.MUSIC: “9 to 5” – Dolly Parton

item.title: Ep. 336: Sight Unseen
item.description: Dealing with moving when you can’t see the place in person
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Dealing with moving when you can’t see the place in person
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang gets together to talk about a phenomenon they’ve all experienced in the last two years: the remote house tour.MUSIC: “Hangover Song” – MJ Lenderman

item.title: Ep. 335: Still Tippin'
item.description: Paying a little extra
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Paying a little extra
item.itunes:summary: Because everything is cyclical, this week, the gang is talking about tipping. The pandemic has changed our relationship with the practice, and it’s time to discuss it again — especially now that more places are starting to phase tipping out in favor of added service fees and the like.MUSIC: “Exhibit C“ – Jay Electronica

item.title: Ep. 334: The One About Home Workspaces
item.description: Where we work when we don’t work from work
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Where we work when we don’t work from work
item.itunes:summary: This week, Max, Pierce and Sean talk about the act of cultivating a home workspace — something so many of us have had to do in the last two years — and some of the ways that that process can maybe go wrong. Does Sean figure out in real time that he ought to rearrange a couple things in his apartment? Maybe!MUSIC: “Gimmie Shelter” – Merry Clayton

item.title: Ep. 333: Three White Guys in Their 30s Talking About F1
item.description: Something new and different
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Something new and different
item.itunes:summary: You’ve never heard that before, right? Apologies if the audio is glitchier than usual.MUSIC: “Kawasaki Backflip” – Dogleg

item.title: Ep. 332: The Overcooked Pork Support Group
item.description: What food do YOU remember from your childhood (but maybe not in a good way)?
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: What food do YOU remember from your childhood (but maybe not in a good way)?
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang gets together to talk about the foods that they ate frequently in their youth that they’ve had to grapple with as they’ve gotten older and started cooking for themselves. Spaghetti comes up a few times, as do the low-fat craze of the late ’80s and early ’90s and the fear of trichinosis that led every parent for multiple generations to cook pork way too long.MUSIC: “(I’m) Screwed” – Titus Andronicus

item.title: Ep. 331: Going, Going, Juan
item.description: It’s Juan-Soto-trade emergency podcast time, y’all
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: It’s Juan-Soto-trade emergency podcast time, y’all
item.itunes:summary: This week, the It’s Pretty OK Sports Brain Trust™️ convenes to talk about the Juan Soto situation. He’s turned down a contract from the Nationals that looks huge on paper but is not nearly as good as it might appear, and now the team is expected to trade him. Where does that leave Pierce, who has been clinging to his Nats fandom even after leaving the D.C. area, specifically because of Soto?MUSIC: “Worth It” – beabadoobee

item.title: Ep. 330: A Return to Rulemaking
item.description: Bringing back a classic It’s Pretty OK format
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Bringing back a classic It’s Pretty OK format
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang is back together for the first time in several weeks. What better way to celebrate than by revisiting a classic pod concept and seeing if we can’t make a rule for society to live by? This time, it’s about what is acceptable attire for a craft brewery — specifically, is it okay to wear another brewery’s T-shirt?MUSIC: “Gotta Let It Go” – Joyce Manor

item.title: Ep. 329: Los Angeles Is Part of the Midwest Now, Apparently
item.description: The B1G gets even B1G-ger
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: The B1G gets even B1G-ger
item.itunes:summary: This week, Sean and Pierce talk conference realignment. Heads spin as they attempt to understand the concept of a college athletic conference that stretches from Piscataway, New Jersey to Los Angeles.MUSIC: “Elvis Is in the Freezer” – Ratboys

item.title: Ep. 328: Borrowed Nostalgia
item.description: On Stranger Things and “remembering” things you weren’t even alive for
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: On Stranger Things and “remembering” things you weren’t even alive for
item.itunes:summary: This week, it’s just Sean and Pierce, and they’re talking about Stranger Things and the phenomenon of borrowed nostalgia. What’s different about this show as opposed to other prestige-TV period pieces like Mad Men or The Americans? And why doesn’t Sean like the Kate Bush song as much as everyone else?NOTE: This episode was recorded before the release of the Stranger Things season 4 finale release, but after we had watched the previous S4 episodes. There’s not much in the way of spoiler-type stuff, but keep that in mind — if you’ve been saving Season 4 to watch until you could binge the whole thing, maybe wait until you’re done to listen?MUSIC: “Once More for the Ocean” – Slothrust

item.title: Ep. 327: That's What Makes U Beautiful
item.description: A chat about pretty campuses
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: A chat about pretty campuses
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang gets together to discuss what makes a college campus beautiful. Is it more than just having a picturesque quad and a few buildings designed in an aesthetically pleasing style of classical architecture? (Yes.) Pierce finally says something nice about Virginia Tech; how long will it be before he goes back to reflexively insulting them? (It’ll be less than a minute.) And we have perhaps our most thrilling Rolling Stone rock trivia question yet.MUSIC: “Mulholland Dr.” – Bartees Strange

item.title: Ep. 326: It's McPodcast Season Again
item.description: On challenge burgers and other over-the-top menu items
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: On challenge burgers and other over-the-top menu items
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang is talking about “stunt foods" — the parade of food challenges (like the Steak ‘n Shake 7x7) and ridiculous seasonal items (like Burger King’s black-bunned Halloween burger) that fast food customers find themselves bombarded with. Is this all the fault of Hardee’s and their risqué mid-2000s burger commercials? And will Sean take more stances that are probably more anticapitalist than he intended for them to be?MUSIC: “The Amarillo Kid” – Craig Finn

item.title: Ep. 325: Summer Treats Make Me Feel Fine
item.description: When the weather is hot, the sweet treats come out!
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: When the weather is hot, the sweet treats come out!
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang gets together to talk about the frozen delicacies that have sustained them through many a hot summer. Will Sean get overly regionally proud about the snowball and then rebut an argument about snowcones that no one actually made? You better believe it. Do multiple people on this podcast endorse the consumption of custard on scorching summer days? Incredibly, yes! And will Max be shocked to discover that the thing he thought was a Northeastern specialty is all over the place, just without the region-specific name? You’ll have to listen to find out.MUSIC: “She Bangs the Drums” – The Stone Roses

item.title: A Special Advance Screening of Ep. 324!
item.description: On being the first one in the theater
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: On being the first one in the theater
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang is talking about the fact that Max went to a midnight movie premiere (no matter what time zone he saw it in). They discuss the phenomenon of the special early release of movies/books/video games/etc. before the conversation unexpectedly turns into a referendum on Kevin’s approach to capitalism. You know, normal stuff.MUSIC: “Heavy Heart” – Bartees Strange

item.title: Ep. 323: Let Them Email About Cake
item.description: On corporate birthday wishes and exploding inboxes
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: On corporate birthday wishes and exploding inboxes
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang gets together to talk about the fact that Pierce is still getting email updates from local businesses in a town he hasn’t lived in in nearly two full years. How has everyone’s inbox gone so crazy? Can Pierce convince us that he’s actually in the right somehow? And is Max ever going to check his damn email?MUSIC: “Intervention” – A Giant Dog

item.title: Ep. 322: Trust the Pod-Cess
item.description: Death, taxes, and Daryl Morey’s project falling short yet again
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Death, taxes, and Daryl Morey’s project falling short yet again
item.itunes:summary: This week, the Sports Bois™️ are together to talk about yet another NBA conference finals that finds itself without Joel Embiid and the Philadelphia 76ers. And while Sean would probably like to spend the entire pod taking a victory lap about that, it fortunately turns into a broader discussion about the dangers of sports teams taking an entirely long-term (or short-term, for that matter) approach.MUSIC: “I Don’t Live Here Anymore (feat. Lucius) – The War on Drugs

item.title: Ep. 321: I Pod, You Pod, We All Pod About iPods
item.description: A send-off to the device that changed music
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: A send-off to the device that changed music
item.itunes:summary: This week, Sean talks to Pierce and Max about “the end of the iPod” and what it means. He also reveals that he is, in the year of our lord two thousand and twenty-two, the owner of a still-thriving (modified) iPod and tries to explain why he is the perfect target audience for the iPod modding craze.MUSIC: “Chaise Longue” – Wet LegADDITIONAL MATERIALAn Ode to the iPod Classic (The Ringer)iPod Modders Give Apple’s Abandoned Music Player New Life (WIRED)

item.title: Ep. 320: To Recommend or Not to Recommend
item.description: Is it really better to give than to receive?
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Is it really better to give than to receive?
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang gets together to discuss recommendations. Is it better to get a good recommendation or to give one? Does the decision change if it’s not about a good recommendation, but just any recommendation? And why are we all so self-centered? Plus, a Pierce apology and a trivia question about unlikely high school classmates.MUSIC: “Detective Lieutenant” – Drug Church

item.title: Ep. 319: The Great Revisitation
item.description: A look back at the movies we used to love
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: A look back at the movies we used to love
item.itunes:summary: This week, Sean is back and the full gang is talking about revisiting movies that you used to watch when you were a kid. Just how goofy is the Ewok storyline from Return of the Jedi? Was his portrayal of the Scorpion King really what catapulted Dwayne “The Rock” Johnson towards becoming the biggest movie star in the world? And is the fact that Flubber is only about 90 minutes long enough to offset the fact that it’s, well, Flubber?MUSIC“Without Me” – EminemADDITIONAL MATERIALSean on the On the Record with Ambi podcast (Apple Podcasts)Big Thief performs “Simulation Swarm” on The Late Show with Stephen Colbert (YouTube)

item.title: Ep. 318: Pod-triot's Day
item.description: Town gatherings galore
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Town gatherings galore
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang gets together (minus Sean) to talk about local celebrations. Not so much the big things that gain a national reputation like Mardi Gras or the cherry blossom festival in DC — more like your small-town strawberry fests and whatnot. Plus, as always, Pierce apologizes, and we have a rock trivia question.MUSIC: ”Now & Later Gators” – Freddie Gibbs, Curren$y and the Alchemist

item.title: Ep. 317: (Company) Swag Surfin'
item.description: Talking about those co-branded Patagonia vests
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Talking about those co-branded Patagonia vests
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang convenes to talk about the various perks that are afforded to the modern knowledge worker by their employer — especially all the branded jackets and backpacks and such. How should we feel about being made walking billboards for our companies? And what happens when we don’t work there anymore?Somewhat predictably, Sean lashes out at corporate America, although it may just be because he’s not getting any swag at work. And there’s a Mad Men reference…but it’s not from Pierce for once.MUSIC: “Country” – Good MorningADDITIONAL MATERIAL: What ‘Severance’ Gets Right About Infantilizing Office Perks (The New York Times)

item.title: Ep. 316: WePodded
item.description: Talking about the flood of “CE-shOws”
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Talking about the flood of “CE-shOws”
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang talks about the flood of entertainment content based around problematic tech CEOs like Travis Kalanick (Uber), Elizabeth Holmes (Theranos), and Adam Neumann (WeWork). Why are there so many books, shows, podcasts, podcasts based on books, shows based on podcasts, etc. about these people?MUSIC: “Halfway Out the Door” – Romero

item.title: Ep. 315: The One About Awards Shows
item.description: Who’s still watching them in 2022?
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Who’s still watching them in 2022?
item.itunes:summary: This week, it’s just Sean and Pierce, and they’re trying to talk about the Academy Awards — and awards shows in general — while desperately avoiding any discussion of the only part of the Oscars that anyone really seems to be talking about. Did it work? Hard to say.MUSIC: “Change Your Mind” – BAD MOVES

item.title: Ep. 314: Live from the 919
item.description: Talkin’ bout tasty beverages, y’all
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Talkin’ bout tasty beverages, y’all
item.itunes:summary: Unfortunately, the initial version of Episode 314 was lost to a technical issue. But in exchange for waiting it out for a week, you get an extra special version of the pod recorded LIVE from the triumphant return of the It’s Pretty OK “Corporate Retreat”/NCAA Tournament Trip!After a night of drinking many — and we do mean many — tiki drinks in Raleigh, first-time/long-time Robert joins the gang to discuss cocktails and whether or not they should be a little bit disgusting.MUSIC: “Phantoms (feat. Open Mike Eagle and Kendra Morris)” – Czarface & MF DOOM

item.title: Ep. 313: The Coach K Farewell Tour Special
item.description: On long goodbyes that maybe last a little too long?
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: On long goodbyes that maybe last a little too long?
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang is talking about what has certainly felt like the most hyped sporting event of our lifetimes: Duke basketball coach Mike Krzyzewski’s final regular-season game against North Carolina. Are they talking about the game itself? Of course not. They explore why it feels so weird to have farewell tours for coaches — or for any individuals in team sports, for that matter — and how this is probably all ESPN’s fault.MUSIC: “Stuck” – Oceanator

item.title: Ep. 312: Poddle
item.description: Talking about the latest gaming craze
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Talking about the latest gaming craze
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang is talking about Wordle and other games that don’t let you do infinite play. Does it turn into a minor squabble over Wordle “hard mode”? Sure does. Does it then segue into a grim look at the future of the ever-consolidating entertainment industry? You better believe it!MUSIC: “The Hardest Cut” – Spoon

item.title: Ep. 311: Feeding the Content Beast
item.description: Talking about the Great Netflix Explosion™️
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Talking about the Great Netflix Explosion™️
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang is talking about Netflix and the explosion of approximately 8 billion new shows of varying quality, seemingly tuned to every possible combination of micro-interests. What’s the deal with that? And why does Sean hate the word “content” so much?MUSIC: “Amber” – 311

item.title: Ep. 310: Dem Franchise Boyz PART 2!
item.description: Evaluating a new generation of NBA superstars
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Evaluating a new generation of NBA superstars
item.itunes:summary: This week, Sean, Pierce and Kevin revisit a conversation they had way back in November 2016 about which NBA star you’d want to build a franchise around. They’re pretty sure they all got it wrong (some more hilariously than others), so they try to assess who were the actual right answers back in 2016 — and then run it back to draft from a new generation of superstars.MUSIC: “Nuthin' But a 'G' Thang” – Dr. Dre and Snoop Dogg

item.title: Ep. 309: It's a Matter of Perspection
item.description: Talking about the way we watch sports, y’all
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Talking about the way we watch sports, y’all
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang is all together to talk about the way that we watch sports. Specifically, is the way that live sports are filmed for TV broadcast wrong? And what the hell does any of that have to do with cows? MUSIC: “Gallo Pinto” – Daniela Andrade

item.title: Ep. 308: Hi, I'm Johnny Knoxville, Welcome to the Podcast
item.description: Is there anything funnier than someone getting hit in the face?
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Is there anything funnier than someone getting hit in the face?
item.itunes:summary: This week, Sean is back after missing last pod due to COVID, and he can’t stop talking about the fact that there’s a new Jackass movie coming out — so the gang talks about nostalgia for a certain kind of comedy that doesn’t get made all that often anymore.MUSIC: “Be That Man” – Madeline Kenney

item.title: Ep. 307: Members, Only?
item.description: Should you join the club? Maybe!
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Should you join the club? Maybe!
item.itunes:summary: This week, Sean is on the injured list with a condition that may or may not rhyme with SHMOVID-19, so the rest of the gang steps in to have a discussion about membership programs. No, not like Costco (although Costco is mentioned) — more like brewery/winery memberships or season passes at ski mountains. They talk about how these programs can help you connect with a new community and revisit how dumb it was for Pierce and Kevin to get Wizards season tickets way back when.MUSIC: “Be a Part” – Dinosaur Jr.

item.title: Ep. 306: Calling an Audible
item.description: They’re like books, but for your earballs
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: They’re like books, but for your earballs
item.itunes:summary: This week, Sean, Max and Pierce talk about audiobooks — a thing they’ve definitely never done before. Sean’s been revising his stance on them. He even made a ham-fisted attempt at defining some audiobook rules for himself…and then broke them almost immediately. But maybe it was a good thing that he did? Plus, another riveting installment of Rolling Stone Rock Trivia Calendar Trivia™️.MUSIC: “Bunny Is A Rider” – Caroline Polachek

item.title: Ep. 305: SPORTS POD GO DAWGS
item.description: All hail Stetson Bennett, the future Chevy King of South Georgia
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: All hail Stetson Bennett, the future Chevy King of South Georgia
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang does an honest to god sports pod: they’re talking about the national championship game won by Georgia. Is Georgia defensive tackle Jordan Davis the largest man who has ever lived? (Maybe!) Remember when Brent Musburger was super horny on national television that time? (Hell yes, I do!) And will Sean stop trying to turn this into a rant about Chargers coach Brandon Staley calling that timeout? (Honestly, probably not!)MUSIC: “Up from Below” – Remember Sports

item.title: Ep. 304: Peyton Manning, Shailene Woodley and Aaron Rodgers Walk Into a Bar
item.description: Who’s a celebrity, and who’s just famous?
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Who’s a celebrity, and who’s just famous?
item.itunes:summary: It’s 2022, and the gang is back to its routine of probing the depths of Pierce’s brain on a weekly basis. This time, they’re talking about the nature of celebrity — especially as it relates to athletes. If you stick around for a few minutes, you’ll get to hear Sean uncork what may be a pretty silly opinion about the relative fame of Aaron Rodgers and Shailene Woodley.MUSIC: “Going Down the Road Feelin’ Bad” – Lucinda Williams & Friends

item.title: Ep. 303: A (Holiday) Tradition Very Much Like Many Others
item.description: Who’s carving the roast beast this year?
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Who’s carving the roast beast this year?
item.itunes:summary: Happy holidays, y’all! This week, the gang talks about what happens when it’s time to pass the responsibility for upholding existing traditions on to new faces/generations/etc., or to develop new traditions altogether. Christmas lasagna, anyone?MUSIC: “Back Door Santa” – Clarence CarterADDITIONAL MATERIALMeet the Investigators podcast: Pandora Papers special edition (ICIJ)The World of Five-Star (Apple Podcasts)

item.title: Ep. 302: You're Talking About Playoffs?
item.description: Is the postseason…basically just the season now?
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Is the postseason…basically just the season now?
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang talks about the expanded seven-team playoff setup that the NFL is moving to this year. How does it compare to the NBA play-in tournament? Are they just asking for more players to get hurt or catch COVID-19? And most importantly, what basketball player is Nicolas Cage most like?MUSIC: “Love and Communication” – Cat Power

item.title: Ep. 301: Ugly Christmas Sweater Podcast
item.description: Why are fast-food joints selling you holiday clothing?
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Why are fast-food joints selling you holiday clothing?
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang is talking about “ugly Christmas sweaters.” Where did this phenomenon come from, and how the hell did it get hijacked by Popeye’s?MUSIC: “Hurt A Fly” – Squirrel Flower

item.title: Ep. 300: Are You Mad, Max?
item.description: Another classic It’s Pretty OK watch-along
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Another classic It’s Pretty OK watch-along
item.itunes:summary: This week, it’s the 300th episode of It’s Pretty OK. We did an episode about 40s for Episode 40 and online dating specials for Episodes 100 and 201, so it’s only natural that the gang would do another special thing for this major milestone. This time, it’s a watch-along, and for #300, there’s only one movie that we could do a podcast on … right?MUSIC: “Pretty Pictures” – Indigo De SouzaADDITIONAL MATERIAL: Adam McKay Says Will Ferrell Won’t Speak to Him (Vulture)

item.title: Ep. 299: The Gift That Keeps On Getting Delayed
item.description: It’s the thought that counts … right?
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: It’s the thought that counts … right?
item.itunes:summary: Happy Thanksgiving, y’all! This week, the gang discusses the supply chain issues forcing people to start their holiday shopping earlier and earlier, and whether it’s really the thought that counts.MUSIC: “have fun” – Jackie Hayes

item.title: Ep. 298: Run, Run, Run
item.description: 🎵 You put one foot in front of the other … 🎵
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: 🎵 You put one foot in front of the other … 🎵
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang talks about a relatively new development: Pierce has started running. Why?MUSIC: “Ben Franklin” – Snail Mail

item.title: Ep. 297: Chain of Fools
item.description: What happens when businesses grow and expand?
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: What happens when businesses grow and expand?
item.itunes:summary: This week, Pierce asks Max and Sean what makes a business like a restaurant a chain. Is it having multiple locations? Is it being in several different cities or states? Or is it maybe something a little more ineffable?MUSIC: “The Chain” – Fleetwood Mac

item.title: Ep. 296: New In Town
item.description: Should you hitch your wagons to the local ballclub?
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Should you hitch your wagons to the local ballclub?
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang talks about whether or not you immerse yourself in the sports culture of your new city when you move. What happens if you move to the home city of your favorite team’s hated rival? And will Max find a bar in Oregon that will let him watch skiing?MUSIC: “Queen of My World” – Bat Fangs

item.title: Ep. 295: We Have the (Breakfast) Meats
item.description: In which we refuse to take sides on “pork roll” vs. “Taylor ham”
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: In which we refuse to take sides on “pork roll” vs. “Taylor ham”
item.itunes:summary: This week, Pierce, Max and Sean talk about breakfast — specifically, the magical world of regional breakfast meats. Just how many different combinations of pig parts are there? Tune in to find out!MUSIC: “The Hardest Cut” – Spoon

item.title: Ep. 294: The Chair-men of the Board
item.description: A chat about the things you fill your home with
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: A chat about the things you fill your home with
item.itunes:summary: This week, Kevin and Max have both recently moved, so the gang talks about furniture. What goes into your thought process when you’re looking for new (or maybe old?) stuff for your home, and how does that process change over time? As always, Pierce apologizes. And Sean recommends two books by members of the Defector army.MUSIC: “Hard to Explain” - Touche Amore

item.title: Ep. 293: Schefter Bomb
item.description: Why does it matter that Adam Schefter sent a story draft to a source for edits?
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Why does it matter that Adam Schefter sent a story draft to a source for edits?
item.itunes:summary: This week, Sean talks to Pierce and Kevin about ESPN’s NFL access merchant, Adam Schefter, getting caught up in the scandal surrounding deposed dirtbag coach Jon Gruden’s gross emails. We know that what you’ve all been clamoring for is a lesson on journalistic ethics from the It’s Pretty OK podcast, so we are happy to oblige. Is Schefter a “journalist”? Does it matter? What are the parallels (and differences) between Schefter’s situation and that of CNN’s Chris Cuomo? All in all, this is riveting stuff — definitely don’t listen to it before bed.MUSIC“Pool Hopping” - Illuminati HottiesADDITIONAL MATERIALJon Gruden emails were part of June court filing by WFT owner Dan Snyder (Los Angeles Times)Adam Schefter Is Pathetic And ESPN Is Gutless (Defector)

item.title: Ep. 292: Double Secret Probation
item.description: A discussion about things you’re not supposed to discuss
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: A discussion about things you’re not supposed to discuss
item.itunes:summary: This week, Sean is back after working on deadline on the Pandora Papers investigation. Pierce wants to talk to him and Kevin about what it’s like doing work that you have to keep secret while it’s in process.MUSIC: “motherless” - hand habitsADDITIONAL MATERIAL: The Pandora Papers (ICIJ) || 5 ways celebrities in the Pandora Papers use the offshore system (ICIJ)

item.title: Ep. 291: A Brief History of "Civilization"
item.description: RPGs, puzzle games, and shooters – oh, my!
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: RPGs, puzzle games, and shooters – oh, my!
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang (minus Sean, for a reason that he’ll talk about for far too long next week) investigates the reasons why Pierce is into board games, but not as enthusiastic about video games.MUSIC: “A Dream With a Baseball Player” - Faye Webster

item.title: Ep. 290: Beers of a Feather Flock Together
item.description: Are variety packs just a scheme to sell unwanted Scotch ales?
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Are variety packs just a scheme to sell unwanted Scotch ales?
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang (all together!) talks about beer variety packs, from the brewery sampler to the grocery store build-your-own six-pack. Does Sean shoehorn in his hatred for pumpkin beer? You bet he does! Plus a special edition of “Kevin Is Sorry.”MUSIC: “Wolf Like Me” - TV on the Radio

item.title: Ep. 289: Flights of Fan-cy
item.description: When do you travel to indulge your fandom?
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: When do you travel to indulge your fandom?
item.itunes:summary: This week, Kevin is thinking about traveling to see sporting events. What would get him to hop on a flight to go see a game? Is it affected by the one specific instance of sports-travel trauma he shares with Pierce and Sean? Will Sean find a way to shoehorn in his “sports fandom is a mental illness” catchphrase? Listen and find out!MUSIC: “Hardline” - Julien Baker

item.title: Ep. 288: It's All About the #RANGZ
item.description: If you don’t win a title, did the season even happen?
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: If you don’t win a title, did the season even happen?
item.itunes:summary: This week, Kevin’s got on a (wedding) ring, so he, Pierce and Sean are talking about #RANGZ culture in sports, particularly the NBA. Is winning championships the only way to evaluate players’ greatness? Is it even a viable way to evaluate them at all? Also, we have the single best breaking news moment in the history of the podcast.MUSIC: “We Are the Champions” - Queen

item.title: Ep. 287: This Pod Is Certified Biodynamic
item.description: Words matter — but do all words matter?
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Words matter — but do all words matter?
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang talks about wine terms. What the hell is “0/0 natural” supposed to mean? Does “sustainable” even mean anything anymore? And how much of this stuff is just marketing mumbo-jumbo?MUSIC: “Dark In Here” - The Mountain Goats

item.title: Ep. 286: The Decline of Western Civilization
item.description: It’s a punk-themed Pierce and Sean Watch-Along™!
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: It’s a punk-themed Pierce and Sean Watch-Along™!
item.itunes:summary: It’s a flashback to the old days — Kevin and Max are dealing with wedding preparations and moving preparations, so it’s just Sean and Pierce. This week, they decided to revisit an old format and talk about something they just watched: Penelope Spheeris’s 1981 documentary about the Los Angeles punk scene, The Decline of Western Civilization. They discuss Darby Crash, the aggression of young men, and Black Flag living in squalor.MUSIC: “Los Angeles” - XADDITIONAL MATERIAL: The 10 worst contracts in the NBA (Good Morning It’s Basketball)

item.title: Ep. 285: The Pod About "Work Drinks"
item.description: A chat about office-sponsored cocktails
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: A chat about office-sponsored cocktails
item.itunes:summary: PagesDesignCommerceMarketingSchedulingNewAnalyticsProfilesCommentsSettingsHelpThis week, Pierce talks to Sean and Max about an article he read calling for an end to work-related happy hours. They discuss whether that stance is really about the “happy hour” part of “work-related happy hour,” think about other social activities that could ease some of the author’s concerns, and refuse to talk about office Christmas parties.MUSIC: “i refuse to die” - Sydney SpragueADDITIONAL MATERIAL: End Office Happy Hours (Slate)

item.title: Ep. 284: Leave the Cronut, Take the Cannoli
item.description: Are we becoming a food podcast by now? (Not really.)
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Are we becoming a food podcast by now? (Not really.)
item.itunes:summary: This week, Kevin went to a place that sells a very special cannoli — only he didn’t get the cannoli. This sparks a conversation about places that have “signature” items. Can you really pass judgment on a place if you didn’t try its specialty? Lest you think this is turning into a food podcast, clothing comes up as well. And stick around to the end to hear Sean butcher a classic line from The Godfather.MUSIC: “Don’t Go Putting Wishes in My Head” - TorresADDITIONAL MATERIAL: Instagram Has Become SkyMall (Debugger)

item.title: Ep. 283: Left Crust, Right Crust
item.description: To half-and-half? Or not to half-and-half?
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: To half-and-half? Or not to half-and-half?
item.itunes:summary: If you’re trying to order pizza but can’t choose between two different toppings, you may have a natural impulse to order a half-and-half with the toppings split … or you might be Pierce. The gang gets together this week to discuss the circumstances in which you would — or wouldn’t — get a split pie.MUSIC: “Polar Bear or Africa” - Jeff Rosenstock

item.title: Ep. 282: Get to Know Your Town!
item.description: It’s time to explore now, because it’ll be time to be nostalgic later
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: It’s time to explore now, because it’ll be time to be nostalgic later
item.itunes:summary: This week, Kevin is starting to prepare for a move, which brings up thoughts and questions about what happens when it’s time to leave town — and why it reminds us that we need to go try new places now.MUSIC: “Middle Child” - Nervous Dater

item.title: Ep. 281: Check Out Our New Menu
item.description: Talking about the new way to order food in restaurants
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Talking about the new way to order food in restaurants
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang returns to discuss the way that certain parts of the restaurant experience — namely, the parts that have to do with choosing and ordering your food — have changed in the last year. Are QR-code menus contributing to the destruction of human interaction? Is any of this going to change back? And is Sean really going to rag on his dad for having a tough time reading menus in poorly-lit restaurants?MUSIC: “Back That Azz Up” - Juvenile (feat. Mannie Fresh and Lil Wayne)ADDITIONAL MATERIAL: It’s over: ‘Vax That Thang Up’ is 2021’s song of the summer (The Verge)

item.title: Ep. 280: Enjoy Your Stay
item.description: A new generation of hotels for, well, a new generation of travelers
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: A new generation of hotels for, well, a new generation of travelers
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang talks about the proliferation of hip hotels that cater to a younger crowd. How are they different from traditional stalwart hotel chains, and does that say anything about a shift in travel priorities?MUSIC: “Black and White” - The dB’sADDITIONAL MATERIAL: “I’ve got tequila on my foot”: It’s last call for Whitlow’s in Clarendon (The Washington Post)

item.title: Ep. 279: The Toast of the Town
item.description: What happens when the top slice of bread goes away?
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: What happens when the top slice of bread goes away?
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang takes up an incredibly important topic: What’s the difference between something like avocado toast and an open-faced sandwich? Is it the dumbest podcast we’ve ever done? Probably! But also maybe not. You’ll have to listen and determine for yourself.MUSIC: “Cheeseburger in Paradise” - Jimmy BuffettADDITIONAL MATERIAL: Reporter spends 15 hours in a Mississippi Waffle House as punishment for finishing last in fantasy football (Twitter)

item.title: Ep. 278: Meet the New Boss, Same as the Old Boss
item.description: What is the millennial lifestyle subsidy? And does it matter that it’s going away?
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: What is the millennial lifestyle subsidy? And does it matter that it’s going away?
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang (minus Sean’s appendix!) gets together to talk about Uber/Lyft, Airbnb and food delivery companies pivoting to profitability. What is the “millennial lifestyle subsidy,” and should anyone actually be surprised by it?MUSIC: “Maybe Your Baby” - Stevie WonderADDITIONAL MATERIAL: Farewell, Millennial Lifestyle Subsidy (The New York Times)

item.title: Ep. 277: Ball Control
item.description: A-spittin’ and a-scuffin’
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: A-spittin’ and a-scuffin’
item.itunes:summary: This week, Kevin, Pierce and Sean are talking about a Sports Illustrated exposé on pitchers using foreign substances to doctor the ball and get a better grip. What are the parallels to the steroid era? And why does MLB keep stepping on rakes it could easily just pick up?MUSIC“Divorce Song” - Liz PhairADDITIONAL MATERIAL“This Should Be the Biggest Scandal in Sports” (Sports Illustrated)Crushed from Religion of Sport (Apple Podcasts // Spotify)

item.title: Ep. 276: So Much Room for Activities
item.description: A pod about hitting the links/slopes/trails/etc.
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: A pod about hitting the links/slopes/trails/etc.
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang talks about “lifetime sports,” the kind of activities that you can do even after your athletic prime has passed. Why do some of them seem to be so expensive, and are there more easily accessible options? Also, Pierce apologizes as usual — only this may be the most off-the-rails apology yet.MUSIC: “Welcome to Earth” / “Bad Feeling” - Cobra ManADDITIONAL MATERIAL: LeBron James’s Agent Is Transforming the Business of Basketball (The New Yorker)

item.title: Ep. 275: Mastering MasterClass
item.description: Unpacking a phenomenon in … education?
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Unpacking a phenomenon in … education?
item.itunes:summary: This week, Kevin brings an article from The Atlantic on MasterClass, the “educational” phenomenon that allows you to buy access to video tutorials from luminaries like Aaron Sorkin and Stephen Curry. Who is the target audience, and is this a good idea at all?MUSIC: “Generic Song About You” - Disheveled CussADDITIONAL MATERIAL:What Is MasterClass Actually Selling? (The Atlantic)Bomani Jones and Spencer Hall talk Stevie Wonder on The Right Time: Apple Podcasts // Spotify // YouTube

item.title: Ep. 274: Shaken, Not Stirred
item.description: One part tequila, two parts thoughtfulness, one heaping dash nostalgia
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: One part tequila, two parts thoughtfulness, one heaping dash nostalgia
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang talks about good old-fashioned home drinking — or maybe more accurately, Old Fashioned home drinking. They explore how cocktails carry a special brand of nostalgia that beer and wine may not be able to match, and Sean and Pierce reminisce fondly on one specific night at one specific bar in DC.MUSIC: “Two Characters in Search of a Country Song” - Country Westerns

item.title: Ep. 273: Looking Out My Back Door
item.description: An ode to the place where you kick back and relax
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: An ode to the place where you kick back and relax
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang is talking about the things that make a backyard into a luxurious paradise. Are you a hot tub guy? Maybe you’re the king of the grill/smoker. Or maybe you just want to kick back and watch some TV while getting some fresh air. There’s something for everyone!MUSIC: “The Lemon Song” - Led Zeppelin

item.title: Ep. 272: A Friendly Wager
item.description: A chat about spicing up Tuesday night baseball games
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: A chat about spicing up Tuesday night baseball games
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang is talking about sports gambling now that sportsbooks are open for business in Virginia. Why is it probably a good idea to decouple sports betting from casinos? And how does ESPN’s Marvel-themed NBA broadcast from a few days ago factor into things?MUSIC: “Lake Erie” - Wild Pink

item.title: Ep. 271: The Year of the Bubbles
item.description: Looking back at the changes in sports over the last year
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Looking back at the changes in sports over the last year
item.itunes:summary: This week, Max is out, so it’s time for a SPORTS PODCAST! The gang looks back at the many changes that sports leagues made over the last year to deal with the coronavirus pandemic and tries to figure out if any of them are good things that should stick around — or if they were all just cynical money grabs to make sure TV contracts were fulfilled.MUSIC: “Faith Healer” - Julien Baker

item.title: Ep. 270: Choosy Podcasters Choose Jif
item.description: A smooth chat about America’s favorite spread
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: A smooth chat about America’s favorite spread
item.itunes:summary: Has the gang finally run out of ideas after 270 episodes? Listen to them talk about peanut butter and decide for yourself.MUSIC: “How Am I Still Alive?” - Lauran Hibberd (feat. Lydia Night of The Regrettes)

item.title: Ep. 269: Back to the Beach
item.description: Getting back into traveling post-COVID
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Getting back into traveling post-COVID
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang talks about starting to dip a toe back into traveling. What are the things you have to think about when you hit the road post-COVID?MUSIC: “Walking to England” - Cloud Nothings

item.title: Ep. 268: Part of a Balanced Podcast
item.description: Pour yourself a heaping bowl of nostalgia
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Pour yourself a heaping bowl of nostalgia
item.itunes:summary: This week, Sean had a bowl of cereal for lunch thanks to Sports? with Katie Nolan’s cereal bracket episode, so the gang talks about what cereals make them nostalgic for a bygone era, what cereals they still buy now, and why Max thinks he likes Grape-Nuts but may really only like the shocking number of spoonfuls of sugar he used to top them with.MUSIC: “Uncomfortable” - SAULT

item.title: Ep. 267: Sitting Where You Eat
item.description: Talking about dining room tables, y’all
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Talking about dining room tables, y’all
item.itunes:summary: This week, an article about formal dining room tables has the gang talking about how what was once considered to be a sacred evening ritual for families has changed. Shocker: It doesn’t necessarily have all that much to do with furniture.MUSIC: “With News from Heaven” - William TylerADDITIONAL MATERIAL: What is the dining table really for? (Vox)

item.title: Ep. 266: Who? Paid How Much?? For WHAT???
item.description: Attempting to make sense of the latest craze
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Attempting to make sense of the latest craze
item.itunes:summary: Attempting to make sense of the latest craze

item.title: Ep. 265: It's March, Let's Do a Bracket Thing (Part 2)
item.description: Concluding the saga: Which state balls the hardest?
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Concluding the saga: Which state balls the hardest?
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang finishes their “which state hoops the best?” bracket. Can anyone topple California? Probably not, but if you listened to the first part last week, you might as well listen to this one too to see how it ends.MUSIC: “Civilian” - Wye Oak

item.title: Ep. 264: It's March, Let's Do a Bracket Thing (Part 1)
item.description: Starting to figure out which state hoops the best
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Starting to figure out which state hoops the best
item.itunes:summary: Since we were all deprived of an NCAA Tournament last year, the gang is doubling up on the brackets this year. In the first installment of a two-part episode, they start to break down which state has produced the best basketball players.MUSIC: “Leave the Door Open” - Silk Sonic (Bruno Mars & Anderson .Paak)

item.title: Ep. 263: Looking Toward the Future
item.description: The pandemic is going to end, so what are we most looking forward to?
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: The pandemic is going to end, so what are we most looking forward to?
item.itunes:summary: This week, some encouraging developments on the pandemic front have the gang daring to dream about a world in which life feels a little more normal. What are they excited to do again? Listen to find out!MUSIC: “Heavy Covenant” - The Hold Steady

item.title: Ep. 262: Au Revoir, Daft Punk
item.description: Bidding adieu to the French electronic icons
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Bidding adieu to the French electronic icons
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang talks about the announcement (via video explosion) that Daft Punk is splitting up after nearly 30 years together. Did you really think we WEREN’T going to use a Daft Punk song as our music this week?MUSIC: “Digital Love” - Daft PunkADDITIONAL MATERIAL: The Vapors: A Southern Family, the New York Mob, and the Rise and Fall of Hot Springs, America's Forgotten Capital of Vice by David Hill (Bookshop.org)

item.title: Ep. 261: Built Pod Tough
item.description: A discussion of reliability and why things aren’t “built to last” anymore
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: A discussion of reliability and why things aren’t “built to last” anymore
item.itunes:summary: This week, a discovery that Sean’s stereo speakers are actually older than he is sparks a conversation about reliability, incentives, and the way that global manufacturing has changed. How did we get from “built to last” to “the internet of things,” and how do heirloom companies like Thomas Moser and Patek Philippe figure into the equation?MUSIC: “Gas Station Food” — the pack a.d.ADDITIONAL MATERIAL: Introducing the Live Music Jukebox (The Pudding)

item.title: Ep. 260: The Tony Bennett All-Stars
item.description: Picking the ultimate starting 5 of the Bennettball era
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Picking the ultimate starting 5 of the Bennettball era
item.itunes:summary: This week, with Max on the road, the gang borrows (co-opts? steals?) a prompt from one of Sean’s group texts and debates the ultimate starting 5 from the Tony Bennett era of Virginia basketball. That’s right, it’s a sportsball one.MUSIC: “Nice Guys” - Beach BunnyADDITIONAL MATERIAL: Samer Recognized A Fart Online (Defector)

item.title: Ep. 259: I Think I'll Have Myself a Beer
item.description: We promise there won’t be any Corona jokes. Seriously.
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: We promise there won’t be any Corona jokes. Seriously.
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang is talking about one of its favorite pastimes: beer. How has your alcohol consumption changed over the last year? And how would it change if you could get free Coors Light (or a similarly cheap beer) for life?MUSIC: “Beer” - Reel Big FishADDITIONAL MATERIAL: Blame Game EP by Beach Bunny (Bandcamp)

item.title: Ep. 258: Animation Station
item.description: Talking about the magic of animation
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Talking about the magic of animation
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang is all together again, and they’re talking about animated movies and TV shows. Believe it or not, they’re not just for kids anymore — although maybe they never were in the first place? And does that justify Pierce’s attempt to watching nothing but animation for the entire month of January? It probably doesn’t.MUSIC: “Louie Louie” - Toots and the Maytals

item.title: Ep. 257: Warby and Allbirds and Everlane, Oh My!
item.description: What even is an “ethical T-shirt”?
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: What even is an “ethical T-shirt”?
item.itunes:summary: This week, Max’s yuppy-tacular shopping trip sparks a conversation about modern brands like Allbirds and Warby Parker that have expanded from online-only businesses into brick-and-mortar retail. What are these brands selling you (apart from shoes and glasses, obviously), and how is it different from what, say, L.L. Bean is selling you?MUSIC: “Heat of the Moment” - Asia

item.title: Ep. 256: Stacks on Stacks on (Sub)stacks
item.description: A chat about the email newsletters taking over your inbox
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: A chat about the email newsletters taking over your inbox
item.itunes:summary: This week, Pierce talks to Sean and Kevin about a New Yorker article on the rise of Substack, the email newsletter platform that has become one of the preferred homes for writers jumping ship from existing media properties. They discuss what makes a newsletter an enticing proposition for a reader, who is using these platforms to publish content, and whether or not you can get rich on Substack (as their CEO has claimed).MUSIC: “No Eyed Girl” - Lemon DemonADDITIONAL MATERIAL: Is Substack the Media Future We Want? (The New Yorker)

item.title: Ep. 255: Big Screen Blues
item.description: How is the pandemic remaking the world of movies?
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: How is the pandemic remaking the world of movies?
item.itunes:summary: NOTE: We recorded this episode before the rioting in D.C. on Wednesday.This week, the gang talks about movies. Well, not just movies, but also the movies. How is stuff like Warner releasing all of its 2021 movies to HBO Max going to affect the world of cinema? And do you even want to go back to a movie theater when it’s safer?MUSIC: “Romance” - Wild Flag

item.title: Ep. 254: Giving SZN
item.description: Navigating the time for gifting
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: Navigating the time for gifting
item.itunes:summary: This week, Sean is out and the rest of the gang is talking about how to avoid some of the stress of holiday shopping.MUSIC: “Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas” - The Beths

item.title: Ep. 253: These Cities Are Made for Walkin'
item.description: A podcast about choosing where we go and how we’ll get there
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: A podcast about choosing where we go and how we’ll get there
item.itunes:summary: This week, a blog post about how Japanese people keep fit simply by walking sparks a conversation about how we choose where we live and how the way cities are laid out influences that decision.MUSIC: “My Iron Lung” - RadioheadADDITIONAL MATERIALI’ve Seen a Future Without Cars, and It’s Amazing (The New York Times)Lego Version of Hokusai’s Iconic The Great Wave off Kanagawa (Kottke.org)

item.title: Ep. 252: Great Expectations
item.description: What do we demand from athletes?
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: What do we demand from athletes?
item.itunes:summary: When the Max is away, the sports fans will play, and this week, Pierce, Kevin and Sean discuss the reaction to ESPN.com’s pre-NBA Draft profile of top overall pick Anthony Edwards, in which the former Georgia star said that he’s “still not really into” basketball and would ditch the sport to play football if the NFL came calling.MUSIC: “Living the Dream (Cuttin’ Grass version)” - Sturgill SimpsonADDITIONAL MATERIALThe pain and promise of top NBA draft prospect Anthony Edwards (ESPN.com)Radio Garden (online and in your app store of choice)

item.title: Ep. 251: So Bad It's Good
item.description: The fine line between Fast and Furious and Phantom Menace
item.itunes:author: It's Pretty OK
item.itunes:subtitle: The fine line between Fast and Furious and Phantom Menace
item.itunes:summary: This week, the gang is talking about when things are just plan bad…and when they’re maybe so bad that they’re actually kinda good? Nicolas Cage movies, Pitbull, The Room, the Fast and the Furious cinematic universe, Star Wars: Episode I – The Phantom Menace, and the 2020 NFC East are all up for discussion.MUSIC: “Open Wound” - Bacchae
